results.title: Quiet challenge
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Concerned about Australia’s lack of success in international sports aviation events, ex-businessman Bill Reilly has established a school for advanced glider-pilot training at Tokamore, N.S.W. Resident championship Ingo Reuner, aeronautical pilot and Bert Persson, engineer, display their skills and explain the fascination that gliding holds for them.

results.title: The People v the 'roo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
The kangaroo is observed in its own environment, and the people who are most likely to affect its future are interviewed: the grazier, the wildlife officer, the shooter and the pet food supplier.

results.title: Orbost v Orbost
results.creator_credit: David Wood, John Sparkes and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Orbost in Victoria is a fairly normal country town, but it has one outstanding feature - two football clubs. Every winter, football becomes the focal point in the lives of most of the local people, and it provides a good deal of their social life. In this film the two local teams compete in the district final, and football fever reaches its highest pitch.

results.title: Mulga Bill's Bicycle Band
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Mulga Bill’s Bicycle Band, a group of musicians from Melbourne, play adaptations of English and Irish folk music. This episode of A Big Country follows the band as they rescue their music from the abstractions of television studios and return it to the living ambience of country halls and hotels.

results.title: The Man from Tocumwal
results.creator_credit: Ken Dyer, John Sparkes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A study of Fred James, managing director of the textile firm Cleckheaton, and new owner of the famous Falkiner Merino Stud at Congaro, N.S.W. James explains his interest in the wool industry, criticises the Australian Wool Board and discusses wool’s marketing and promotional problems. Also shows his modern textile mill at Shepparton, Victoria.

results.title: The Legend of Jimmy Governor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Looks at the life of a half-caste Aborigine who killed a dozen white people in 1900. He is immortalised in Thomas Keneally’s novel, and Fred Schepisi’s film of the book, The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith. A Big Country filmed Keneally on location and includes interviews with Fred Schepisi and Tommy Lewis, who plays Jimmie Blacksmith.

results.title: A Land fit for heroes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Examines the harsh reality that lay behind the concept of parcelling out plots of land for soldiers returning from both the first and second world wars. Uses archival footage, interviews and old radio broadcasts. Reporter - Ron Iddon. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Kiwis
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams, John Sparkes, Janet Bell and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Ernie Leonard, a Maori who had relinquished his traditions and heritage became chief of his tribe at the age of 55. He had been a television compere, later becoming a television producer and Ernie was able to show how he had learnt language and traditions and helped in fostering this knowledge in the young. He now produces a television program in Maori each week called ‘Koha’.

results.title: Dingo country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A fence almost 6,000 miles long stretches from South Australia to Queensland and attempts to separate the dingo from the sheep. The dingoes are vigorously hunted and killed, but the film presents the view that man must learn to acept the dingo.

results.title: Running to stand still
results.brief_description: Adrian Bush tells the story of how, after spending most of his life on the move, he found friendship and a sense of belonging playing street soccer in Fitzroy, Melbourne, with others from the Big Issue team. Adrian was selected for the Australian street soccer team, which toured internationally, and appeared in an ABC documentary. His experiences with the Big Issue and street soccer have transformed Adrian’s life.
